# Scatter mapping description



## Upload sample data

You need to upload one data files including sample data.

Such as

| chao1  | jost1 | Group |
| ------ | ----- | ----- |
| 637.5  | 190.7 | HSL   |
| 965.7  | 430.7 | HSL   |
| 929.5  | 367.3 | HSL   |
| 545.5  | 165.1 | HSL   |
| 1212   | 702.3 | AA    |
| 1336.5 | 823.7 | AA    |
| 1389   | 870.5 | AA    |
| 1294.8 | 804.2 | AA    |
| 914.7  | 426.2 | DS    |
| 852.5  | 335.1 | DS    |
| 1049.4 | 503   | DS    |
| 1089.1 | 504.6 | DS    |
| 833    | 309.4 | DS    |
| 849.5  | 336.9 | DS    |
| 849.5  | 301.1 | DS    |
| 992    | 426.4 | DS    |

You need **two columns of data** to determine the x-axis and y-axis, and you **can also add another column of data to group**.

**Paying attention, please ,you need to upload the file in the format of the sample data**.



## draw

- When you enter a **string** in **the goups button**, the scattered points will be grouped and colored according to the third column of information.

  <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jinhuili-lab/personal_image_bed/master/img99202201112134046.png" style="zoom:33%;" />

  <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jinhuili-lab/personal_image_bed/master/img99202201112134107.png" style="zoom:33%;" />



- You can add this button**("whether add text label")** to determine whether to mark information above the scatter points. And according to this button**("what to choose as a label for the scattered points")**, you can choose to label the information on the x-axis or y-axis.
